model.interfaces

Interface Player

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Player>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimplePlayer

    public interface Player
extends java.lang.Comparable<Player>
     Interface for representing the player.
 To be implemented by SimplePlayer class with the following constructor.
          public SimplePlayer(String id, String playerName, int initialPoints)
 Note: Player id is unique and if another player with same id is added it replaces the previous player.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerName

        java.lang.String getPlayerName()
        Getter for the player's name attribute.
        Returns:
        human readable player name

      • setPlayerName

        void setPlayerName(java.lang.String playerName)
        Setter for the player's name attribute.
        Parameters:
        playerName - human readable player name

      • getPoints

        int getPoints()
        Getter for the player's initial points attribute.
        Returns:
        number of points from setPoints()

      • setPoints

        void setPoints(int points)
         Setter for the player's name attribute.
 Note: Updated by GameEngine.applyWinLoss(Player, int) with each win or loss.
        Parameters:
        points - for betting

      • getPlayerId

        java.lang.String getPlayerId()
        Getter for the player's id attribute.
        Returns:
        the player id which is generated by the implementing class

      • setBet

        boolean setBet(int bet)
        Setter for the player's bet attribute. Note: must use resetBet() for 0 bet since not valid for this method.
        Parameters:
        bet - the bet amount in integer
        Returns:
        true if bet is greater than 0 and player has sufficient points to place the bet

      • getBet

        int getBet()
        Getter for the player's bet attribute.
        Returns:
        the bet as set with setBet()

      • resetBet

        void resetBet()
        Method to reset the bet to 0 for next round (in case player does not bet again in next round).

      • getResult

        int getResult()
        Getter for the player's result attribute.
        Returns:
        the result of the most recent hand as set by setResult(int)

      • setResult

        void setResult(int result)
        Setter for the player's result attribute.
        Parameters:
        result - the result of the most recent hand (updated from the GameEngine via GameEngine.dealPlayer(Player, int))

      • equals

        boolean equals(Player player)
        Method to evaluate whether two players are equal.
        Parameters:
        player - another player to compare with
        Returns:
        true if the player id is equal

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object player)
         Overridden Object.equals(Object) method.
 Note: This implementation should cast and call through to the type checked method above

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
         Overridden Object.toString() method.
 Format is as follows, "Player: id=1, name=The Shark, bet=100, points=900, RESULT .. 38"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
